title: How to Plan a Kitchen Renovation

steps.headline: Decide how much you can spend on your kitchen renovation.
steps.description: The amount of your budget will often dictate the rest of the planning process. Establish a range instead of a fixed budget number. For example, budgeting $7,500 to $8,500 is more reasonable than deciding to spend exactly $8,000.

steps.headline: Include all of the elements of a kitchen renovation when estimating your budget.
steps.description: You will potentially need to pay for new appliances, flooring, countertops, hardware, paint, ventilation, cabinets and installation costs. Set aside money in your budget for unexpected problems, delays, expenses and contingencies. The National Kitchen and Bath Association (NKBA) advises you add 20 percent of your budget to your estimate for surprises and contingencies.

steps.headline: Plan for labor, and think about the level of expertise you expect in your kitchen renovation.
steps.description: You will need a general contractor as well as plumbers, electricians and other specialists.

steps.headline: Commit to your budget.
steps.description: You will need to decide where you want to save and where you want to spend. For example, if stainless steel appliances are a priority, you might need to settle for laminate flooring.

methods.name: Gathering Design Ideas for a Kitchen Renovation

steps.headline: Think about how you will use the kitchen.
steps.description: You might use it only occasionally because you eat out a lot, or perhaps you have a large family who gathers there for 3 meals every day. Figure out what works well and what needs improvement. For example, if you cannot reach half of your cabinets, make sure they are lower when you remodel. Optimize your efficiency. When you plan the layout of your kitchen, think about how you move when you are in there cooking, cleaning and eating. For example, you do not want your sink to be too far from your dishwasher.

steps.headline: Look for inspiration.
steps.description: Check out kitchen magazines, read blogs on the Internet and examine sample kitchen in design showrooms and stores. Pay attention to colors, textures, fabrics and surfaces. Get inspiration in large things, such as floors or countertops as well as small details such as knobs on drawers and storage.

steps.headline: Pick a style.
steps.description: Planning your kitchen renovation will depend on whether you prefer a modern kitchen, a classic and traditional style or something that resembles a beach cottage.

steps.headline: Consider energy efficiency.
steps.description: Many kitchens are going green by using energy efficient appliances and lighting, as well as sustainable materials for floors and windows.

methods.name: Hiring Professionals to Renovate a Kitchen

steps.headline: Figure out how much professional help you need.
steps.description: You might want everything; an architect, designer, builder and contractor as well as a team of sub-contractors. Or, you might want to do it yourself and call in help when you get stuck. Talk to contractors, at the very least. Unless you are experienced with building and renovations, you will need someone to help you get necessary permits and manage the overall project.

steps.headline: Ask for estimates from at least 3 contractors.
steps.description: You should do the same thing if you are working with designers and other professionals. Getting at least 3 quotes or estimates will help you determine who fits into your budget.

steps.headline: Talk about timeframes.
steps.description: Once you hire a contractor, discuss how long the work will take. This will help you plan your renovation and how you will function without the use of your kitchen.
